intro: Anthistiria ciliata var. burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant has slender, branched stems and narrow, elliptical leaves with ciliate margins. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly encountered in its natural habitat.
